LanguageData.SHG_ModDescription:
Much like the people in superhero stories, pawns with these genes can accomplish incomprehensible feats and slay countless foes with ease. Killing a super often requires extraordinary weapons, or a bigger monster.

The core module of the Superhero Genes series.

The checkboxes of each section only hide the options, they do not set anything.
LanguageData.SHG_CondensedMeteorsDescription: Allows the condensed summons(i.e condensed steel, condensed jade, and condensed components) to appear as rare meteors. If enabled and a meteor lands, it's recommended that you DON'T mine it all immediately for obvious reasons (colony wealth increases).
LanguageData.SHG_MultipleMutationsDescription: Removes the normal limitation of one mutation per superpowered pawn.
LanguageData.SHG_MultipleArchetypesDescription: Removes the normal limitation of one archetype per superpowered pawn. Individual archetypes may have certain things that make them incompatible with other archetypes, but there is no longer a global tag excluding all archetypes.
LanguageData.SHG_ExpensiveBaseDescription: Sets the superhero base gene to have a metabolic efficiency of -8(equal to the bonus gained through taking all of the unsuper genes), and adds a dormant super archetype that is the equivalent of taking all the unsuper genes at once.
LanguageData.SHG_SupersEverywhereDescription: Makes all non-custom xenotypes gain the superhero base gene, and exchange some of their negative genes for their more severe antisuper counterparts. This will also catch xenotypes added by other mods, but because it always errs on the higher metabolic efficiency side, you may end up with some xenotypes with more than +5 metabolic efficiency. I have made some patches to correct some mods, but let me know if there's a particularly aggregious one you'd like taken care of.
LanguageData.SHG_ActivatableSuperGenesDescription: Instead of having all the genes give a bunch of constant bonuses, the bonuses are locked behind an ability that must be activated to receive those boons. If active long enough, the pawn will begin gaining increasing boosts to their consciousness, and ever increasing risk of heart attack. It takes half a day for the side effects to begin appearing.
LanguageData.SHG_InterruptibleActivatablesDescription: Instead of activating almost instantly, the abilities take 10 seconds to activate, making it much harder to use them mid battle.
LanguageData.SHG_MiddleGrounds: Middle Ground Basic Super Genes (Restart Required)
LanguageData.SHG_MiddleGroundsDescription: Adds a second option for all of the basic super and antisuper genes. This adds 16 new genes.
LanguageData.SHG_AllGrounds: All Ground Basic Super Genes (Restart Required)
LanguageData.SHG_AllGroundsDescription: Extends the options for all of the basic super and antisuper genes to the maximum extent. This adds 27 new genes in addition to the 16 added by middle ground, for a total of 43 new genes.
LanguageData.SHG_SuperAI: Autocast Abilities (Restart Required for any changes)
LanguageData.SHG_SuperAIDescription:
This causes colonists to automatically try to use some of their super abilities when appropriate. This is disabled by default for a few reasons. 

First, some may not like the idea of having the pawns they are supposed to be controlling doing things on their own. 
The second reason is that this can cause the game to run slower due to the game needing to process more things by itself. 
And the last reason is that, as many of us have probably noticed, AIs have a tendency of getting caught up on the weirdest stuff, acting in ways that don't quite make sense and making it harder for you to play the game. 

Most abilities will not try to activate if the pawn is drafted, but some of them will interrupt you in specific situations(i.e. If autocast healing is enabled, the pawn has a sealing abiltity, and they are bleeding, they will first try to seal their wounds with said ability). 

Second note, while Hemomancer and Psionist abilities are on the automated lists, they are the last ones used. The order of abilities chosen is Generic Powers > Psionic Powers > Hemomantic Powers > Pool Consuming Powers(if enabled). 

Casting while drafted is a separate option because some people may not like the idea of pawns acting on their own in battle. Usually, the pawn will only autocast while drafted if it does not have a forced job, so you usually don't need to worry about a pawn standing still when you really, really need them to move. One of the most notable exceptions where the pawn will ignore orders is self healing wounds when bleeding a lot, though the only abilities ever available for this purpose have a cast time of one or lower.
LanguageData.SHG_AllowPoolUsageDescription: Some abilities grant powerful bonuses in the short term, but cause the super to have various debuffs afterwards. If this disabled, then these abilities will never be autocast.\n\nTo avoid having the AI use these abilities when it makes no sense, the only autocast categories that will use this abilty are autocast defense and autocast healing.
LanguageData.SHG_AutomaticHealerDescription: Makes multiple healing abilities automatically cast, along with the basic revive ability. This will also include the vanilla Coagulate ability as one of the last resort ability-based healing methods.\n\nYou may occassionally be unable to stop a pawn that's reviving a colonist by drafting them due to the nature of the ability. Revival will only be attempted while the pawn is undrafted and there are no enemies on the map. The pawn will also revive forbidden colonist corpses, so you don't need to worry about one being missed that way. If you want to dispose of the corpse rather than revive it, you will need to keep the reviver drafted or manually busy as your other colonists deal with the corpse.
LanguageData.SHG_AutomaticDefenseDescription: Makes multiple defensive abilities automatically cast while the pawn is undrafted. If the pawn is undrafted and finds enemies nearby, then it will use the defensive abilities it has based on the situation. For example, if the pawn is shot at while they have a smokescreen-like ability, said ability may be used to minimize the chances of getting shot more. This will only attempt to use specific abilities from Superhero Genes. The pawn will avoid using abilties if they already have a defensive ability active to ensure they don't just stand there repeatedly buffing themselves when they should be fighting or fleeing.
LanguageData.SHG_AutomaticDefenseDraftedDescription: Pawns will try to use the same abiilties as they would while undrafted in a dangerous situation. This is a separate option because you may encounter situations where pawns will use their defensive abilities in ways that may differ from your play style. The pawn will avoid using abilties if they already have a defensive ability active to ensure they don't just stand there repeatedly buffing themselves when you need them to shoot something.
LanguageData.SHG_AutomaticBuffsDescription: While the pawn is undrafted, they will automatically use their hediff adding beneficial abilties as they see fit. If the pawn has stacking abilities (like the hemo-warriors armor buffs), they fall under this category and are only used if A) they don't have a cost, or B) the related resource has reached high enough levels that the AI assumes it's fine. The AI will always seek to keep stacking buffs to just beyond their highest levels (to avoid having it end up lost due to the pawn being drafted for a few hours), but will otherwise ignore them. Drafted pawns also will not use these abilities to avoid situations where they cast abilities at weird times.\n\nFor abilities that normally have a regenerating resource(i.e. Hemomancers due to their high hemogen recovery will automatically use their abilities), the pawn checks their target resource level instead of a static number. If your colony doesn't have a steady resource pack supply and have pawns that need those packs to survive, it is recommended you disable auto-consuming packs for that pawn so they don't constantly consum packs to get themselves to the highest level.
LanguageData.SHG_AutomaticDebuffDescription: Makes multiple debuffing abilities automatically cast while the pawn is undrafted. If the pawn is undrafted and finds enemies nearby, then it will use the debuffing abilities it has against the pawn they are targetting. This will also cause pawns to try to use berserk abilities on enemies/random animals whenever there are enemies on the map, assuming said abilities don't make the targets attack colonists or non-enemies.\n\nDue to the nature of how pawns think, they don't use when enemies are too close. Also, they only try to use debuffs when set to attack nearby targets, so there will be a middle-ground where enemies are close enough to keep getting debuffed, but not close enough to start attacking.
LanguageData.SHG_AutomaticDebuffDraftedDescription: Pawns will try to use the same abiilties as they would while undrafted in a dangerous situation. This is a separate option because you may encounter situations where pawns will try to use their debuffing abilities in ways you may not want them to, and keeping it separate gives you an override. The pawn will avoid using abilties if their target already has the debuffing ability active to ensure they don't just stand there repeatedly debuffing the enemy with the same ability.\n\nDue to the nature of how Rimworld handles jobs, pawns will only attempt to use this when interrupted (i.e. ordered to move to a new location, got hit by an enemy, just finished casting an ability, just got drafted, etc). While this is usually not an issue for supers with a large number of abilities, it's recommended to treat this more as an additional help than a primary method of debuffing enemies, as this AI is more reactive than proactive. Drafted Auto-Offense handles some of these issues for pawns that have one or two offensive abilities.
LanguageData.SHG_AutomaticOffenseDescription:
Makes multiple offensive abilities automatically cast while the pawn is undrafted. If the pawn is undrafted and finds enemies nearby, then it will use the offensive abilities it has based on the situation. For example, if their enemy doesn't have any of the pawn's allies nearby, it may choose to use a blast power instead of a bolt.

To avoid accidents, powers that can set things on fire are excluded from this.

Due to the nature of how pawns think, they don't use offensive abilities often, and while undrafted, they only try to use offensive abilities when set to attack nearby targets.
LanguageData.SHG_AutomaticOffenseDraftedDescription: Pawns will try to use the same abiilties as they would while undrafted in a dangerous situation. This is a separate option because you may encounter situations where pawns will keep spamming their offensive abilities at an enemy, even if you were hoping they'd just shoot normally.\n\nDue to the nature of how Rimworld handles jobs, pawns will only attempt to use this when interrupted (i.e. ordered to move to a new location, got hit by an enemy, just finished casting an ability, just got drafted, etc). While this is usually not an issue for supers with one or two offensive abilities, it's recommended to treat this more as an additional help than a primary method of killing enemies, as I can't guarantee that the AI will keep attacking.
LanguageData.SHG_AutomaticFleeingDescription: While the pawn is undrafted, they will automatically try to use their abilities while fleeing when the situation warrants it. If they are set to flee when enemies are nearby, they will often try to use whatever escape abilities they have at their disposal, from blink to invisibility to heroically leaping away. This includes the vanilla invisibility and longjump legs as methods of last resort.\n\nWarning: While it usually is not an issue, a pawn fleeing from a melee opponent may be so distracted trying to flee that they forget they can teleport. They will try to flee if an enemy is within a range of 20, but there are situations where this may not apply. In conclusion, treat this setting as an assisting autocast rather than an something that always saves pawns.
